intro: Metrosideros collina, commonly known as the coastal hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its vibrant red or orange flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, thriving in sandy soils and salty air. It has a shrub-like growth habit and can reach heights of up to 3 meters. Metrosideros collina plays an important ecological role in coastal ecosystems, providing habitat and nectar for native wildlife.
